results.title: Silence speaks: digital storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US and ACMI
results.brief_description: The content has been created as part of the “Silence Speaks” project, an international movement that provides the survivors of violence and abuse with an opportunity to tell their own stories. A co-production between ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling (US) to coincide with Real Life on Film. “Silence Speaks” represents the most recent examples of Australian documentary making.

results.title: Silence
results.brief_description: An outstanding drama about an autistic boy, Eric, who gets lost in the woods during a camping trip with his foster parents. Academy award winning director, John Korty, sensitively explores the new world Eric has discovered … a wilderness inhabited by animals who demonstrate an affection the boy has rarely received from human beings. Man of the mountains, Crazy Jack, befriends him and is instrumental in re-uniting Eric with his family in an emotion charged ending.

results.title: Silas Marner
results.creator_credit: Giles Foster, Louis Marks and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Unjustly accused of theft and cast out from a small 19th century religious community in the Midlands, the young Silas Marner seeks solace and solitude in hard work and a new environment. But when he is robbed of his entire savings by the wayward son of the local squire, it seems he has lost everything for a second time, until a young child mysteriously finds her way into his cottage one winter’s night, and Silas Marner’s life is changed forever. A dramatic adaptation of George Eliot’s novel which stars Ben Kingsley and Jenny Agutter.

results.title: Silage: A New method
results.brief_description: The method of vacuum fodder conservation, and its advantages. A stack is built on a black plastic groundsheet, inside a steel forming-ring which rises as the stack is built. A plastic dome is spread over the stack, sealed to the groundsheet and the air is then pumped out. The dome is removed and the consolidated stack covered with a plastic cover. This method of making silage adaptable to farm routine, permits conservation of difficult crops and involves minimum labour and waste of fodder.

results.title: Silage making on every farm
results.brief_description: One of the problems of raising stock is to get enough protein food for it, particularly on an all-the-year-round basis. Silage is the answer, and this film for farmers goes into all the details of silos and silage making, showing the most straightforward and economical methods.

results.title: Signs of trouble. Aspects of delinquency. Ep. 2. We hate school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Truancy and disruptive behaviour at school are on the increase. This program looks at the causes and possible solutions. This second part of the series, Signs of Trouble, was shot in Britain and the USA, and introduced by Laurie Taylor, Professor of Sociology at the University of York.

results.title: Signs of Life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Brisbane College of Advanced Education AV Prod Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Deaf Community has been an unknown and misunderstood minority group for far too long. In this lively, informative video, the stereotypes are blown away. Here we see deaf people leading normal, purposeful lives, participating in a wide range of activities which their thriving community supports and talking about their lives with inspiring candour, insight and humour.
